hackathon-description-text: HackMed is a medical hackathon aimed at developing creative solutions to solve problems within medicine and healthcare. It is a student-run event for individuals from various backgrounds interested in the crossroads of life sciences and technology.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: iPazzPort Upgraded Backlight Mini Wireless Keyboards

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Data by Oxford Nanopore Technologies
Best Use of the Nexmo API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 4 Vouchers for the GitHub shop [more information to follow]

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=32 Leavygreave Rd, Sheffield S3 7QY, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Did the solution solve a real-world medical problem? How much of an impact will it have on medicine and healthcare?
How hard was it to implement the solution? Was it a simple website or did the team build something that we’ve not seen before?
How new the idea? Is it the next Uber for doctors or are they creating something groundbreaking new?
Did the team build something with the end user in mind? How polished is the hack?

hackathon-description-header: How would you use technology to improve medicine & healthcare?
